repnme.cdata!:
Macedonia - Legal and Judicial
            Implementation and Institutional Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Legal and Judicial
            Implementation and Institutional Support Project for
            Macedonia were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was substantial;
            bank performance was bank performance; and borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned include: infrastructure activity took the
            lion's share of the Bank financing as well as
            supervision efforts. If infrastructure is seen as a
            precursor or the first sequence in reforming the judiciary,
            then a secondary or equally important reform would be to
            building the capacity technical, human and planning
            capacities of the judiciary to maintain and consolidate the
            achievements made to date. The national judicial training
            academy has made important advances in improving the overall
            capacity of the judges, prosecutors and supporting staff at
            a time of rapid change in the country's legal
            framework. Nevertheless, it must be said with the rapidly
            evolving legal framework, consolidation of this learning and
            the reforms will take more time than the timeframe, and is
            subject to reversals. Finally, measuring this project's
            success is extremely difficult given the Macedonian justice
            sector's rapid transformation during project design and
            implementation. It will take considerable time and resources
            to consolidate all of the reforms set in place during
            Project design and implementation. The project made positive
            contributions to the implementation of new court case
            management and bankruptcy procedures, and streamlining
            administrative cases, and as such, the Project's
            success should ultimately be measured with this in mind.

repnme.cdata!:
Macedonia, former Yugoslav Republic of -
            Legal and Judicial Implementation and Institutional Support
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Legal and Judicial
            Implementation and Institutional Support (LJIIS) Project is
            to contribute to improving judicial efficiency and
            effectiveness and the business climate in FYR Macedonia by:
            (i) enhancing ministerial and judicial capacity to
            systematically implement the Government's Judicial
            Reform Strategy and key laws; and (ii) improving judicial
            infrastructure. The extension is needed to allow full
            disbursement of loan funds for the construction of the
            building. The costs of the remaining construction (EUR
            5,051,848) exceed available loan funds for the construction
            (EUR 1,763,730) and Government funds will be needed to
            finalize the building. Given the recent reduction in
            counterpart funds for Bank projects by the Government of FYR
            Macedonia and the lack of an explicit commitment by the
            Ministry of Finance to expand Government co-funding from
            currently budgeted EUR 1 million to the required estimated
            amount of EUR 3,288,118 the risk of closing the project
            before the completion of the Skopje criminal court building
            is moderately high.

repnme.cdata!:
Macedonia - Legal and Judicial
            Implementation and Institutional Support Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Legal and Judicial
            Implementation and Institutional Support (LJIIS) Project for
            Macedonia is to contribute to improving judicial efficiency
            and effectiveness, as well as the business climate by:
            enhancing ministerial and judicial capacity to
            systematically implement the judicial reform strategy and
            laws affecting the judiciary; and improving judicial
            infrastructure. The reallocation is necessary to finance: 1)
            Information Technology (IT) equipment for the new high
            administrative court in Skopje. The court is fully equipped
            with office furniture and with the Automated Court Case
            Management and Information System (ACCMIS) funded by the
            LJIIS project, but still requires suitable IT equipment to
            become fully functional; and 2) a) hardware for the state
            administrative inspectorate and Ministry of justice, b) a
            survey on judicial efficiency, including an indicator
            measuring the impact of the LJIIS project, and c) other
            expenditures related to the 8-month closing date extension period.

repnme.cdata!:
Macedonia - Legal and Judicial
            Implementation and Institutional Support Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Legal and Judicial
            Implementation and Institutional Support (LJIIS) Project for
            Macedonia is to contribute to improving judicial efficiency
            and effectiveness, as well as the business climate by: (i)
            enhancing ministerial and judicial capacity to
            systematically implement the judicial reform strategy and
            laws affecting the judiciary; and (ii) improving judicial
            infrastructure. The closing date for the project will be
            extended from July 31, 2011 until March 31, 2012. It is
            anticipated that remaining activities will be fully
            completed in the eight-month extension period. Planned
            activities that will be completed are: (i) the construction
            period of the new Criminal Court in Skopje exceeds the
            current closing date of the Project (July 31, 2011). Due to
            general delays in starting this activity, and unforeseeable
            delays at the start of the construction, including water
            supply pipelines in the foundations, the construction was
            delayed by a total of ten months. The anticipated completion
            date is in January, 2012; (ii) to allow for a complete and
            thorough analysis and final report, an extension of the
            contract for the functional analysis from July 31, 2011, to
            December 31, 2011, will provide the firm with sufficient
            time to complete their analysis of the courts and for the
            Judicial Council to test the analysis; and (iii) due to a
            change in the management of the public administration from
            the Ministry of Justice to the Ministry of Information
            Technology, and the need for the Minister to familiarize
            him/herself with the Bank's procurement rules and the
            LJIIS project, this activity has encountered Delays. This
            will be the first extension of the project.
